metadata.title: CVE-2021-29154 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
BPF JIT compilers in the Linux kernel through 5.11.12 have incorrectcomputation of branch displacements, allowing them to execute arbitrarycode within the kernel context. This affects arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp.cand arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp32.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-209-generic - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-4.4.0-209-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-4.4.0-209-lowlatency - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-4.4.0-209-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-4.4.0-209-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-4.4.0-209-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-4.4.0-209-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-209-generic - 4.4.0-209.241
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-209-lowlatency - 4.4.0-209.241
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-142-generic - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-142-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-142-lowlatency - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-142-generic - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-142-lowlatency - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1092-kvm - 4.4.0-1092.101
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1127-aws - 4.4.0-1127.141
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1099-aws - 4.15.0-1099.106~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1113-azure - 4.15.0-1113.126~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1098-gcp - 4.15.0-1098.111~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1070-oracle - 4.15.0-1070.78~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1151-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1151.162
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1155.165
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-209.241').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1092.101').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1127.141').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1099.106~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1113.126~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.111~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1070.78~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1151.162').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1155.165').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
